revised_title: On the Comparison of Transcendents and Applications to Definite Integrals
tldr: The author presents a theorem for the summation of integrals with limits determined by the roots of an algebraic equation, and applies it to the comparison of algebraic and functional transcendents. The theorem allows for the finite expression of the value of the sum of a series of integrals, with potential applications to the extension of the theory of multiple definite integrals.
